div.p:
In the Name of God Amen. This ninth day of January ano. One thousand
Six hundred and seventy five and in the 44th year of the Dominion of the right
honorable [Cecilius] absolute Lord and proprietor of the province of Maryland I Thomas
[Mathens] of Charles County in the province of aforesaid [Gentry?] being sick and weake
in body but of sound and perfect memory praise be to god for the same and
Knowing the uncertainty of this life and being
the uncertainty of this life and being desirous to sell things in order doe
make this my last will and testament in manner and form following that is to say
first and principally I comend my soule to god my creator believing that
I shall recieve full pardon and of all my sins and be saved by the
precious Death and merits of our beloved Savior and reademer Christ Jesus
and my body to the earth from where it came to be buried in such decent and
Christian manner as to my Execturos thereafter named shall be thought and
Convenient and as touching such wordle Estate as god hath lent me my will
and meaning is the same shall be imformed and bestowed as hereafter by this
my will is exchanged and first and principally. I do will and require that all
my Just Debts be truly satisfied discharged and paid and I doe hereby revoke
renounce frustrait and make void all wills by me formely made ad declare
and appoint this my last will and testament.

I givr and bequeath unto my wife Jane Mathuse my holl personal Estate that is at
Port Tobacco that is to say all manner of things for the good of her and my childring
and I do give and bequeath to her my wife Three hundred acres of Land called the
Lunchelbury Swamp or bulky lying in Charles County and I give and bequeath
to my son Thomas Mathens Seven hundred acres of land being part of a thousand
acres of Land lying upon Matawoman branches and that he have that part
which he hath already sealed upon and I give to my D. Capt. Bormans wife
three hundred acres of land which is the remainder of that I give my son Thomas
and to him and his heirs forever and to her heirs forever I do alsoe give
and
and bequeath to my son Thomas Mathens and to my D. after Mary
Borman two hundred and fifty five acres of Land lying at St. Maries
Hill threshold Early to be divided between them to them and their heirs
forever and I give to my wife Jane Mathews four hundred acres of
Land lying at Capt. Bonman three cows and three yearling calved and five
stears about four years of that belongs to the plantation of S. Ellins
and to my wife I give and bequeath all the other things that belongs to
the said plantation of St. Ellins that is Tobacco Debts or other things
whatsoever that shall be due to mee. and I doe further make Constitute
and afront m head and loving wife Jane Mathews my Executor to see
this my will performed but if in Case my wife should dy before me then
it is my will that my son Thomas Mathews and Capt. William Borman
be Executor of this my will to see it performed in testimony and witness
whereof I have hereunto set my hand and seal this day and year above
said
Ignatius Causen
his
Marke W Lamson.
mark
Tho. Mathews

On the back of the aforegoing will was the following probit to
March the 11th 1675 This day Came before me before me Ignatius Causen and Mark
Lamson and made oath that they saw the said Mr. Thomas Mathews sign
seal and deliver this as his last will and testament as witness our hands
and seals.

Sworn before me this 11 of March
Henry Adams
6 1/4 sides
